sensors.name: Air/Space Radar
sensors.description: The minimal sensor system acceptable on a spaceship hull, the air/space radar is the most common sensor system of the Fusion Age. It works equally well in atmospheres or open space.

sensors.name: EM Detector
sensors.specialBonus: -2 step bonus vs targets using active sensors
sensors.description: The electromagnetic detector is an antennae array designed to detect and localize EM emissions such as radio signals and radar beams. If the target is using active sensors, the EM detector gains a -2 step bonus on the sensor check. Against non-emitting targets, it suffers a +2 step penalty.

sensors.name: Hi-Res Video
sensors.description: A high-powered camera system designed to spot targets by their visual profile. It includes a very powerful zoom feature, allowing close inspection of far-off targets. Perfect for evaluating damage the target has suffered.

sensors.name: IR Detector
sensors.specialBonus: -2 step bonus vs maneuvering fusion/ion/antimatter engines
sensors.description: Also known as a heat sensor, the infrared detector looks for targets that are radiating infrared energy. It confers a -2 step bonus to sensor checks against targets maneuvering with fission rocket, fusion torch, ion engine, or antimatter rocket.

sensors.name: Ladar
sensors.effect: Ignores jamming; passive vs non-ladar targets
sensors.description: A laser detection and ranging system uses low-powered laser beams to pinpoint the target. Ladar ignores jamming, and it's considered a passive sensor if the target does not itself possess ladar or a laser transceiver.

sensors.name: Probe
sensors.description: A small rocket fitted with a video camera and a small air/space radar set. Has acceleration of 50 KPH per phase and enough fuel to operate for up to 48 hours. Transmits video and radar data up to 100 Mm clearly, 1000 Mm with degradation.

sensors.name: Mass Detector
sensors.description: Extremely sensitive sensor that measures subtle differences in local gravity caused by mass distortions. Can determine target bearing and approximate range by measuring the target's influence on the sensing ship. Ignores chaff countermeasures.

sensors.name: Multiband Radar
sensors.description: A more powerful and sophisticated version of the air/space radar, operating across multiple frequency bands for improved detection and tracking.

sensors.name: Probe, Advanced
sensors.description: A PL 7 version of the probe with acceleration of 2000 KPH per phase and enough power to operate for up to 72 hours. Transmits data up to 1000 Mm clearly, 1 AU (150 million km) with degradation.

sensors.name: Remote Network
sensors.rangeSpecial: Doubles range of one other sensor
sensors.effect: Doubles range of one sensor; 1 day duration
sensors.description: A constellation of sensor probes deployed in a ring or globe thousands of kilometers in diameter. Doubles the range of one other sensor system designated at installation. Deploys in one round, stays active for one day. Ship loses network if it changes course or speed.

sensors.name: Spectroanalyzer
sensors.specialBonus: -2 step bonus to Battle Damage Assessment
sensors.effect: Analysis tool; -2 step bonus to BDA
sensors.description: Combines spectrum analysis of visible light, radar mapping, and precise mass measurements to create a profile of a planet or space object. Confers a -2 step bonus on sensor checks for Battle Damage Assessment and astronomy/planetology skill checks.

sensors.name: Drive Detection Array
sensors.effect: Detects FTL arrivals/departures across interstellar distances
sensors.description: Detects starfalls and starrises of ships traveling by stardrive. Range of 50 light-years with 11-hour propagation delay. Indicates ship class and number of ships. Does not function while the array-equipped ship is in drivespace.

sensors.name: CE Passive Array
sensors.specialBonus: -4 step bonus vs targets using active sensors
sensors.effect: Combined EM/IR/video; -4 step bonus vs active targets
sensors.description: This system collates and analyzes all electromagnetic energy received by the sensor. It combines the properties of an EM, IR, and video scan and receives a -4 step bonus to detect a target using active sensors.

sensors.name: Drive Detector
sensors.effect: Compact FTL detection; same capability as PL7 array
sensors.description: Works like the PL7 drive detection array but is much smaller and cheaper. Detects FTL events within 50 light-years with 11-hour delay.

sensors.name: Mass Radar
sensors.description: Uses pulses of gravitational energy to precisely range and pinpoint objects. Can penetrate up to 100 km of ice/water, 20 km of stone, or 2 km of nickel-iron. Ideal for locating bases buried deep underground.

sensors.name: Multiphase Radar
sensors.description: An advanced radar system with track-with-scan capabilities. Due to its sophisticated signal processing, the multiphase radar has a tracking capability 50 percent higher than normal.

sensors.name: Omniscience Sphere
sensors.description: Based on rare psi-technology, automatically detects any and all objects within 50 megameters. Must be manned by a psionic character with ESP broad skill (costs 2 psionic energy points per hour). Cannot rest or meditate while operating.
